name: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A classic novel depicting the roaring twenties in America.

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A powerful portrayal of racial injustice in the American South.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel exploring the dangers of totalitarianism.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A classic coming-of-age novel capturing the angst of adolescence.

name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The first book in the beloved Harry Potter series, introducing the magical world of Hogwarts.

name: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A classic fantasy novel, the precursor to The Lord of the Rings trilogy.

name: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A timeless romantic novel exploring themes of love and societal expectations.

name: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: A science fiction novel about an astronaut stranded on Mars and his struggle for survival.

name: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel about a young shepherd's journey to discover his personal legend.

name: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic novel exploring the obsession of Captain Ahab with the white whale, Moby-Dick.

name: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An ancient Greek epic poem telling the story of Odysseus's adventures and journey home.

name: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: A horror novel about a family's winter stay at an isolated hotel with a haunted past.

name: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel exploring a future society where technology controls every aspect of life.

name: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A Gothic novel about the consequences of scientific experimentation and the nature of humanity.
